title: Continuous Colormap
text:
source

get_continuous_cmap

 get_continuous_cmap (hex_list:list[str], float_list:list[float])

creates and returns a color map that can be used in heat map figures. If float_list is not provided, colour map graduates linearly between each color in hex_list. If float_list is provided, each color in hex_list is mapped to the respective location in float_list.




Type
Details




hex_list
list
list of hex code strings


float_list
list
list of floats code strings


Returns
LinearSegmentedColormap





cmap_1000 = get_continuous_cmap(['#2AA364', '#F5EB4D', '#9E4229', '#381D02', '#381D02', '#381D02'], float_list=[0, 0.15, .6,.75,.8,1])
cmap_1000

my_cmp  underbad over

title: Continuous Colourmap Fuction
text:
How to use
Simple paired colors and splits to generate a continuous colourmap.

hex_list = ['#2AA364', '#F5EB4D', '#9E4229', '#381D02', '#381D02', '#381D02']
float_list=[0, 0.15, .6,.75,.8,1]
cmap_1000 = get_continuous_cmap(hex_list = hex_list, float_list = float_list)
cmap_1000

my_cmp  underbad over 



hex_list = ['#2AA364', '#F5EB4D', '#9E4229', '#381D02', '#381D02']
float_list=[0, 0.65, .75,.8,1]
cmap_1000 = get_continuous_cmap(hex_list = hex_list, float_list = float_list)
cmap_1000

my_cmp  underbad over
